Authors:
Aida Marcela Vasco-Palacios, Carlos Lopez-Quintero, Ana
Esperanza Franco-Molano, Teun Boekhout
Title:
Austroboletus amazonicus sp. nov. and Fistulinella
campinaranae var. scrobiculata, two commonly occurring boletes from a
forest dominated by Pseudomonotes tropenbosii (Dipterocarpaceae) in
Colombian Amazonia
Keywords:
Boletaceae, Dipterocarpaceae, ectomycorrhizal fungi,
fungal diversity, Guiana shield, Neotropics
Abstract:
Two boletes that frequently form fruiting bodies in
Pseudomonotes tropenbosii forests are described from Colombian Amazonia.
One is a new species of Austroboletus here introduced as A. amazonicus
and the other one is Fistulinella campinaranae var. scrobiculata Singer,
which is a new record for Colombia. Macromorphological,
micromorphological, and ecological data for these species are provided
as well as DNA sequence data from nuclear ribosomal regions of the
internal transcribed spacer (ITS) and 28S large subunited (LSU).
